defaultMessage: Assuming you have not used the Qtum Wallet client before, when you first open the Bodhi Dapp, you are generating a brand new Qtum wallet.
Qtum uses the Bitcoin Core wallet infrastructure.
Bitcoin wallets already contain roughly 100 different addresses assigned to one wallet. This is why you might see new addresses appearing in your wallet.
The Qtum Wallet is responsible for holding your passphrase and private keys. Bodhi Dapp does not store or handle this for you.
We never transmit, receive, or store your private key, passphrase, or other account information.
You are simply using our interface to interact directly with the Qtum blockchain.
If you send your public key (Qtum address) to someone, they can send you QTUM or BOT.
If you send your passphrase, wallet data file, and/or private key to someone, they now have full control of your account.
Bodhi Dapp Uses The Qtum Wallet
